sen.j: 鎮護国家（ちんごこっか）は、政府が仏教を利用して内政の安定を図ろうとした政策、または、仏教には国家を守護・安定させる力があるとする思想。
sen.e: Chingokokka refers to a government policy to stabilize internal affairs using Buddhism or a thought that Buddhism has power to protect and stabilize a country.
Chingokokka refers to a government policy to stabilize internal affairs using Buddhism or a thought that Buddhism has power to protect and stabilize a country.
Chingokokka refers to a government policy to stabilize internal affairs using Buddhism or a thought that Buddhism has power to protect and stabilize a country.

tit.cmt: 他記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 思想としては『仁王護国般若波羅蜜経』や『金光明最勝王経』に説かれている。
sen.e: The thought was advocated in "Ninno gokoku hannyaharamitsu kyo Sutra" and "Golden Light of the Most Victorious Kings Sutra."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The thought was advocated in "Ninno gokoku hannyaharamitsu kyo Sutra" and "Golden Light of the Most Victorious Kings Sutra."
The thought was advocated in "Ninno gokoku hannyaharamitsu kyo Sutra" and "Golden Light of the Most Victorious Kings Sutra."

sen.j: この経典を供養することで国家が守護されるとされているところから、南北朝時代_(中国)の中国や奈良時代の日本で盛んに仁王会や最勝会などの法要が行われた。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China and Nara period in Japan, Buddhist services, such as Ninno-e festival and Saisho-e (Lecture series based on the Suvarnaprabhasottama-sutra), were often held because it was believed that a country would be protected by recitation of these Buddhist scriptures.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: During the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China and Nara period in Japan, Buddhist services, such as Ninno-e festival and Saisho-e (lecture series based on the Suvarnaprabhasottama-sutra), were often held because it was believed that a country would be protected by recitation of these Buddhist scriptures.

During the period of the Northern and Southern Dynasties in China and Nara period in Japan, Buddhist services, such as Ninno-e festival and Saisho-e (lecture series based on the Suvarnaprabhasottama-sutra), were often held because it was believed that a country would be protected by recitation of these Buddhist scriptures.

sen.j: また、鎌倉時代には、時代の転換期であり、また蒙古の襲来など、社会情勢が不安定であった。
sen.e: Moreover, in Kamakura period, Japan was at a turning point, and the attacks of Mongolia, for example, made the society unstable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, in the Kamakura period, Japan was at a turning point, and the attacks of Mongolia, for example, made the society unstable.
Moreover, in the Kamakura period, Japan was at a turning point, and the attacks of Mongolia, for example, made the society unstable.

sen.j: それ故、栄西の『興禅護国論』、日蓮の『守護国家論』、『立正安国論』など、鎌倉新仏教の開祖たちによって、仏教の思想（自派の教義）こそ国を救うものであると盛んに説かれている。
sen.e: Therefore, the founders of Kamakura New Buddhism had energetically preached that Buddhistic doctrines of their school would save a country, for example, Eisai's "Kozengokoku-ron" and Nichiren's "Shugo kokka-ron (Treatise on protection of the nation)" and "Rissho Ankoku-ron."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, the founders of Kamakura New Buddhism had energetically preached that Buddhistic doctrines of their school would save the country, for example, Eisai's "Kozengokoku-ron" and Nichiren's "Shugo kokka-ron (Treatise on protection of the nation)" and "Rissho Ankoku-ron."

Therefore, the founders of Kamakura New Buddhism had energetically preached that Buddhist doctrines of their school would save the country, for example, Eisai's "Kozengokoku-ron" and Nichiren's "Shugo kokka-ron" (Treatise on protection of the nation) and "Rissho Ankoku-ron" (Treatise for Spreading Peace Throughout the Country by Establishing the True Teaching).
sen.cmt: 立正安国論 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 特に、日蓮は立正安国論の中で盛んにこれを喧伝し、政府による国立戒壇の建立によって国家と人々は救済されると説く。
sen.e: Especially, Nichiren energetically spread the thought in "Rissho Ankoku-ron" and preached that the country and people would be saved by erection of the Kokuritsu kaidan (the establishment of the National High Sanctuary).

Especially, Nichiren energetically spread the thought in "Rissho Ankoku-ron" and preached that the country and people would be saved by erection of the Kokuritsu kaidan (the establishment of the National High Sanctuary).

Especially, Nichiren energetically spread the thought in "Rissho Ankoku-ron" and preached that the country and people would be saved by erection of the Kokuritsu kaidan (the establishment of the National High Sanctuary).

tit.j: 鎮護国家と「国家仏教」説

sen.j: 近年では、「国家仏教 （こっかぶっきょう）」という表現が使われることもある。
sen.e: The term, National Buddhism may be used in recent years.
The term, National Buddhism may be used in recent years.
The term, 'National Buddhism' is sometimes used in recent years.
sen.cmt: 一部表現を変更しました。

sen.j: これは以下のように解説されている。
sen.e: This is explained as follows.
sen.cmt: 「～解説されている」をここに統合しました。
sen.e: This is explained as follows.
This is explained as follows.

sen.j: “国家権力と結び、国家の保護・支配下におかれた仏教。"
sen.e: This is the Buddhism that was connected to national power and was put under national protection and control.
This is the Buddhism that was connected to national power and was put under national protection and control.
This is the Buddhism that was connected to national power and was put under national protection and control.

sen.j: "僧侶は僧尼令の規制を受ける国家公認の官僧のみが認められた。"
sen.e: Only the official monks authorized by the country and regulated by Soni ryo (Regulations for Monks and Nuns) were approved as Buddhist priests.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 用語集の「官僧」にスペルの誤りがありました。
sen.e: Only the official monks authorized by the country and regulated by Soni ryo (regulations for Monks and Nuns) were approved as Buddhist priests.
Only the official monks authorized by the country and regulated by Soni ryo (regulations for Monks and Nuns) were approved as Buddhist monks.

sen.j: "許可なく得度する僧（私度僧）は禁じられた。"
sen.e: Those who entered Buddhist priesthood without permission (shidoso) were illegal.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。 用語集の「得度」にスペルの誤りがありました。
sen.e: Those who entered Buddhist priesthood without permission (shidoso) were illegal.
Those who entered Buddhist priesthood without permission (shidoso) were illegal.

sen.j: "また、僧尼を統括する僧綱という官職が設けられた。"
sen.e: Moreover, Sogo (Office of Monastic Affairs), which controlled monks and nuns, was established.
Moreover, the Sogo (Office of Monastic Affairs), which controlled monks and nuns, was established.
Moreover, the Sogo (Office of Monastic Affairs), which controlled monks and nuns, was established.

sen.j: "官寺が多く建てられ、鎮護国家の法会を行った。"
sen.e: Many kanji (state-sponsored temples) were built, and Buddhist services of the Chingokokka were held.
Many kanji (state-sponsored temples) were built, and Buddhist services of the Chingokokka were held.
Many kanji (state-sponsored temples) were built, and Buddhist services of the Chingokokka were held.

sen.j: しかし、実際のところ歴史学者や仏教学者の間でも何をもって「国家仏教」と定義づけるのかについては統一した見解が出されているわけではない。
sen.e: However, "National Buddhism" has been variously defined among historians and Buddhist scholars.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, "National Buddhism" has been variously defined among historians and Buddhist scholars.
However, historians and Buddhist scholars have not yet reached a united opinion regarding what would define 'National Buddhism.'

sen.j: また「国家仏教」という表現そのものが古代仏教の実態を反映しておらず不適当とする考え方もある。
sen.e: Moreover, some say that the usage of "National Buddhismﾓ does not reflect the realities of ancient Buddhism; therefore, it is inadequate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Moreover, some say that the usage of "National Buddhism" does not reflect the realities of ancient Buddhism; therefore, it is inadequate.
Moreover, some say that the usage of 'National Buddhism' does not reflect the realities of ancient Buddhism; therefore, it is inadequate.

sen.j: まず、鎮護国家とされる国家によって官寺と呼ばれる寺院の建立・維持が行われて国家と皇室の安泰を祈るための法会が行われたという事実は存在する。
sen.e: First of all, in fact, the temples called kanji had been erected and maintained by so called Chingokokka, and Buddhist services had been held to pray for peace and security of the country and Imperial Family.

First of all, in fact, the temples called kanji had been erected and maintained by so called Chingokokka, and Buddhist services had been held to pray for peace and security of the country and the Imperial Family.

First of all, in fact, the temples called kanji had been erected and maintained by so called Chingokokka, and Buddhist services had been held to pray for peace and security of the country and the Imperial Family.

sen.j: しかし、その政権が仏教の国家宗教化を意図した具体的な政策例は存在しない。
sen.e: However, there had been no specific policy that intended to establish Buddhism as the national religion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, there had been no specific policy that intended to establish Buddhism as the national religion.
However, there had been no specific policy that intended to establish Buddhism as the national religion.

sen.j: 道教や神道などの他の宗教の主流が弾圧を受けた事実が存在しない。
sen.e: In addition, there had been no fact that other religions, such as Taoism and Shintoism, had been suppressed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In addition, there had been no fact that other religions, such as Taoism and Shintoism, had been suppressed.
In addition, there had been no fact that other religions, such as Taoism and Shintoism, had been suppressed.

sen.j: また、僧尼令や僧綱についても官寺以外に対してどこまで適用されたかについても議論がある。
sen.e: Moreover, there has been controversy about how far the Soni ryo and the Sogo applied to temples other than kanji.
Moreover, there has been controversy about how far the Soni ryo and the Sogo applied to temples other than kanji.
Moreover, there has been controversy about how far the Soni ryo and the Sogo applied to temples other than kanji.

sen.j: 僧尼令や僧綱が官寺・官僧を厳格に統制していたのは事実であると考えられている。
sen.e: It is thought that the Soni ryo and the Sogo strictly controlled the kanji and the official monks.
It is thought that the Soni ryo and the Sogo strictly controlled the kanji and the official monks.
It is thought that the Soni ryo and the Sogo strictly controlled the kanji and the official monks.

sen.j: だが、僧尼令制定以前から私寺は建立され続けていた。
sen.e: However, private temples had been erected before the establishment of Soni ryo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, private temples had been erected before the establishment of Soni ryo.
However, private temples had been erected before the establishment of Soni ryo.

sen.j: このうち貴族や豪族の氏寺はともかく、村々の住民が信仰の中心として建てた小規模な寺まで実際に監督することが可能であったのかについては疑問が残されている。
sen.e: Among these, aside from family temples of nobles or local ruling families, whether small temples worshiped by people in villages could be supervised has been questionable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Among these, aside from family temples of nobles or local ruling families, whether small temples worshiped by people in villages could be supervised has been questionable.
Among these, aside from family temples of nobles or local ruling families, whether small temples worshiped by people in villages could be supervised has been questionable.

sen.j: 実際、日本の僧尼令では僧尼が私寺を建立することは禁じたものの、その他の私寺に関しては平安時代の延暦年間の太政官符において初めて規制された。
sen.e: In fact, although Japanese Soni ryo prohibited erection of private temple by monks and nuns, other private temples were regulated for the first time by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) in Enryaku era of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In fact, although Japanese Soni ryo prohibited erection of private temple by monks and nuns, other private temples were regulated for the first time by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) in the Enryaku era of the Heian period.

In fact, although Japanese Soni ryo prohibited erection of private temple by monks and nuns, other private temples were regulated for the first time by Daijokanpu (official documents issued by Daijokan, Grand Council of State) in the Enryaku era of the Heian period.

sen.j: これは僧尼令や僧綱の対象が僧尼であって仏教そのものを対象にした法令ではなかった事実の反映である。
sen.e: Therefore, Soni ryo and Sogo were applied to monks and nuns, and they did not regulate the Buddhism itself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Therefore, Soni ryo and Sogo were applied to monks and nuns, and they did not regulate Buddhism itself.
Therefore, Soni ryo and Sogo were applied to monks and nuns, and they did not regulate Buddhism itself.

sen.j: 更に正史などの記録や『日本現報善悪霊異記』のような仏教説話には僧尼令の規定とは違った僧尼の姿が描き出されている。
sen.e: Furthermore, documents, such as the Official History, and Buddhism tales, such as "Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories, written in the late 8th and early 9th century, usually referred to as the Nihon Ryouiki), portrayed monks and nuns who were not complied with Soni ryo.

Furthermore, documents, such as the Official History, and Buddhism tales, such as "Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories, written in the late 8th and early 9th century, usually referred to as the Nihon Ryouiki), portrayed monks and nuns who did not comply with Soni ryo.

Furthermore, documents, such as the Official History, and Buddhism tales, such as "Nihon genho zenaku ryoiki" (set of three books of Buddhist stories, written in the late eigth and early ninth century, usually referred to as the Nihon Ryoiki), portrayed monks and nuns who did not comply with Soni ryo.
sen.cmt: スペルを一部修正しました。

sen.j: 更に私度僧についても課役忌避のための出家に対しては処罰された。
sen.e: Furthermore, as for shidoso (priest having entered Buddhist priesthood without permission), although it was punished for the ordination into priesthood to avoid assignments.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, as for shidoso (priest having entered Buddhist priesthood without permission), it was punishment for ordination into priesthood to avoid assignments.
Furthermore, as for shidoso, it was punishment for ordination into priesthood to avoid assignments.
sen.cmt: 既出単語の補足を削除しました。

sen.j: しかし、修行の実績がある私度僧には却って得度を許して官僧へ取り込む措置すら取られている。
sen.e: On the other hand, shidoso with ascetic practice were allowed to enter the Buddhist priesthood as offical monks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On the other hand, shidoso with ascetic practice were allowed to enter the Buddhist priesthood as official monks.
On the other hand, shidoso with ascetic practice were allowed to enter the Buddhist priesthood as official monks.

sen.j: 鎮護国家において仏教が保護されて官寺が建立されてその監督体制が整備されて国家と皇室の安泰が祈願されていたのは事実である。
sen.e: It is true that Buddhism was protected and that the kanji had been erected and systematically maintained by Chingokokka to pray for peace and security of the country and Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is true that Buddhism was protected and that the kanji had been erected and systematically maintained by Chingokokka to pray for peace and security of the country and Imperial Family.
It is true that Buddhism was protected and that the kanji had been erected and systematically maintained by Chingokokka to pray for peace and security of the country and Imperial Family.

sen.j: しかし、室町幕府の五山や江戸幕府の寺院諸法度と比較しても、それを「国家仏教」とまで呼べるのかについては議論が残されている。
sen.e: However, comparing with gosan (Zen temples highly ranked by the government) of the Muromachi bakufu or the Jiin Shohatto of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), whether it may be called "National Buddhism" remains debatable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, comparing with gosan (Zen temples highly ranked by the government) of the Muromachi bakufu or the Jiin Shohatto of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), whether it may be called "National Buddhism" remains debatable.

However, comparing with gosan (Zen temples highly ranked by the government) of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) or the Jiin Shohatto (laws for temples) of Edo bakufu, whether it may be called 'National Buddhism' remains debatable.
sen.cmt: 寺院諸法度 補足を追加しました。
